subject_terms_3: Photography City Hall (Singapore) City Council Sculpture
physical_appearance: This is a black-and-white photograph of a hall. In the center of the photograph, there is a sculpture of figure with no head or arms, mounted on a rectangular base. There are three doorways in the background. The photograph is slightly faded, with specks of white seen
sgcool_label_text: George Lowe was a member of the British Expedition that saw Sir Edmund Hillary scale Mount Everest on 29 May 1953. In September that year, Lowe accompanied Hillary on a visit to Singapore to deliver their first Everest lecture outside of New Zealand at the Odeon Theatre to an audience of 1,620 schoolchildren. This photograph album, with the coat of arms of the City of Singapore in gilt on the cover, was presented to Lowe as a souvenir of his visit.
title_text: Photograph album presented to George Lowe as a souvenir of his visit to Singapore George Lowe album: Photograph of hall in former City Hall building
subject_terms_2: Photographs Photograph albums Souvenir Lowe, George, 1924-2013 Hillary, Edmund, 1919-2008 Sculpture
